inkface.widgets – Inkface Widget Library¶

class inkface.widgets.inkobject.InkObject¶

This is the base class of Inkface widgets.

It defines and implements the signal interface for the widgets.

connect(signal_str, callback)¶

Connect a signal handler to this widget.

Parameters:
  • signal_str – Name of the signal to register the handler for
  • callback – A callback handler to be called when this signal is emitted
disconnect(signal_str, callback)¶

Disconnect a signal handler from this widget.

Parameters:
  • signal_str – Name of the signal for which this callback handler was registered.
  • callback – The callback handler which was originally connected to handle this signal.
emit(signal_str, *args)¶

Emit the signal.

Parameters:
  • signal_str – Name of the signal to emit.
  • *args –

    Any number of additional parameters to be passed to the callback handler. The widget subclass should document the signature of the callback handler and should pass these extra args accordingly
class inkface.widgets.keyboard.Keyboard(face)¶

An on-screen virtual keyboard widget

Parameter:face – A face object whose elements will be used to render the virtual keyboard.

Signals:

done¶

When user has indicated that it’s done with the virtual keyboard, this signal is emitted. No args are passed to callback handler

keypress¶
When user presses or clicks any of the keys of this virtual keyboard, this signal is emitted.

Args passed to callback handler:

param keyVal:A string representing the character OR a special constant to indicate special keys.
hide()¶
Hides the keyboard
unhide()¶
Unhides the keyboard
class inkface.widgets.textbox.Textbox(border_elem, txt_elem, cursor_elem, keyfocus=None, focus_elem=None, framerate=25, mask=None, multiline=False, kbd=None)¶

A textbox widget.

This widget can be realized by passing at least three inkface.altsvg.element.Element objects to its constructor - border, txt, cursor.

Parameters:
  • border_elem – An SVG element that defines the boundary of the textbox. If the text exceeds this boundaries of this element, then it is automatically truncated (only visually) or wrapped.
  • txt_elem – A text SVG element whose text will modified to what user inputs.
  • cursor_elem – A cursor element which will blink at submultiple rate of framerate
  • focus_elem – An optional element which will appear when the textbox has focus.
  • keyfocus – A keyfocus object. (TBD)
  • framerate – framerate in FPS
  • mask – A mask character, in case one wants to hide the text.
  • multiline – Not supported yet.
  • kbd – A virtual keyboard widget inkface.widgets.keyboard.Keyboard
get_text()¶

Get the current text content of this textbox.

Return type:Text string
set_text(text)¶

Set the text contents of this textbox

Parameter:text – Text string to be set
